title: CAPA-001: Align All 9 Templates Between QMS and Seed

comment:
QA PRE-REVIEW: CR-098 v0.1 -- RECOMMEND

FRONTMATTER VERIFICATION:
- title: "CAPA-001: Align All 9 Templates Between QMS and Seed" -- present, descriptive
- revision_summary: "Initial draft" -- appropriate for v0.1

STRUCTURAL COMPLIANCE (SOP-002 Section 6):
All 12 required sections present:
- Sections 1-9 (pre-approved): Purpose, Scope (2.1-2.3), Current State, Proposed State, Change Description (5.1-5.3), Justification, Impact Assessment (7.1-7.3), Testing Summary, Implementation Plan (9.1-9.5)
- Sections 10-12 (execution): EI table (8 items with VR column), Execution Comments, Execution Summary, References

PLACEHOLDER CHECK:
- No draft placeholders ({{...}}) remain
- Execution placeholders ([SUMMARY], [Pass/Fail], etc.) correctly present
- No TBD, TODO, FIXME, or XXX found

PARENT TRACEABILITY:
- Parent Document: INV-013 (CAPA-001) -- explicitly stated in Section 2.1
- Related CRs properly referenced: CR-089, CR-091, CR-095

CONTENT ASSESSMENT:
- Change Description Section 5.1 provides 12 specific schema v3-to-v5 changes for TEMPLATE-VR. Sufficiently detailed for execution.
- Section 5.2 shows exact EI table column additions for CR/ADD/VAR seed templates. Clear and actionable.
- Section 5.3 establishes QMS copy as authoritative for Category C reconciliation -- sound reasoning since those copies passed through document control.
- 8 EIs cover all 9 templates (Category C bundled into EI-6, reasonable given cosmetic nature).
- Testing Summary includes diff comparison and qms-cli test suite verification.

OBSERVATION (not a deficiency):
Lines 61, 64, 70 contain Unicode arrow character (U+2192) which caused qms_read encoding error. The character is semantically appropriate for version transition descriptions and does not appear in machine-parsed fields. This is a QMS CLI encoding limitation, not a document quality issue.

TU ASSIGNMENT: None needed. Template content alignment with no code logic changes.
